attributes.additional_details:
Currently all Political Parties can say and print what they like within the Party Manifestos and then ditch their promises after they are elected by saying too difficult or didn’t understand that we wouldn’t be allow to do that.
All parties have shadow cabinet members and therefore they should be held responsible to do their job and ensure that what they propose can and will be completed if and when they gain power.
All Political Party Manifestos must therefore be made a legal document that is approved by law for the party gaining power to cover in their elected period of power from the General Election.
If there is a hung Parliament and therefore a coalition agreement the changes to the Manifestos must be published for all members of the public to see what has been agreed by the parties and again it will then become a legal document to be followed through the time of the Parliament.
